title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 7200.14 - Representation by counsel
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 7200.14 - Representation by counsel

State Regulations
(a) A claimant and the attorney whose
alleged conduct resulted in the claim shall have the right to be represented by
an attorney. (b) In
accordance with rules of the Appellate Divisions of the Supreme Court, no
attorney who assists a claimant process a claim with the fund shall charge or
accept compensation for those services, without the prior written approval of
the trustees. No fee applications by attorneys, including public officers and
court-appointed fiduciaries, shall be approved by the trustees absent a showing
of extraordinary circumstances. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22
ยง
7200.14

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
